website_summaries.verdict: This chart gives you mounting options with both magnets and hanging tabs.
pros: Includes cards for 20 different chores and behaviors
Reusable plastic stars attach with hook-and-loop material
Includes blank labels for unique chores
cons: Designed for use with a single child

customer_reviews.title: My 2 year old HATED going to bed and staying in bed
customer_reviews.text: This chart has been a life saver! My 2 year old HATED going to bed and staying in bed, we still struggle sometimes but the chart has helped so much. He loves putting the start on for brushing teeth, going potty, etc. Plus it comes with a few "make your own."
customer_reviews.author: RLL*

customer_reviews.title: ... have strong-willed kids and found this to be a great parenting tool
customer_reviews.text: I have strong-willed kids and found this to be a great parenting tool. The "chores" cover both behavioral items, self care, and actual chores... plus they give you a couple blank ones so you can create your own if needed. I found this product after successfully using the potty chart by this same company, which was recommended by a child behaviorist. It is a very tangible way for a child to see their progress and creates an opportunity for open dialog about behaviors and expectations with your child.
customer_reviews.author: Mama2

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddler!
customer_reviews.text: We love this reward chart! There are so many different options you can put on the chart, and my 2.5 year old LOVES earning stars and putting them on the chart. It's been helping us with tooth brushing and staying in bed all night. We've been trying to figure out a way to convince our son to not come snuggle with mom and dad in the middle of the night, and with the star rewards (we've given him a treat after 3 stars are earned) he seems to be more excited about staying in his own bed. That's a big win for us!
customer_reviews.author: Kate Zingsheim

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for young kids that need some structure!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a 3-4 yr old needing some structure, this is perfect! I recommend only doing a few chores at a time, too many can be overwhelming! We’ve gotten some of our chores into daily routine and now I’ve taken them off the chart and added new ones.
customer_reviews.author: Keirstonmarie

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant for toddlers.
customer_reviews.text: This product is perfect in every way! It was clearly designed by parents of small children. My son is 3 and struggles to do the smallest things when he’s in a mood. These little icons of tasks are perfect because he can see what he’s supposed to be doing. The excitement of earning a gold star gets him to do what he’s supposed to with minimal whining. I’m sure the novelty will wear off but for now I’ll take the good behavior!!!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great chart!
customer_reviews.text: My almost 4 year old loves this! The picture help remind him what he's working for and the fact that it's magnetic and you can use a dry erase on it is great! I do wish that there was a version for even younger kids though because my 2 year old really wants to engage with it too. My 4 year old loves to review the day and put his own stars on. Definitely helping us teach better manners, character, discipline, and habits! Would highly recommend to other parents. The Velcro is awesome!! I wish the star for the name was bigger though, but definitely not worth removing a star from the rating.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie H.

customer_reviews.title: Cute and Effective Goal Chart
customer_reviews.text: This is a cute and effective chore/goal chart. It’s easy to put together and start using. My 2 year old loves to earn stars and it has helped with Potty training! The pieces stick on like Velcro. They are easy to attach and detach so my daughter can be the one to reward herself. I bought two (one for my niece as well). They help motivate the kids to get along, share toys, and stay in bed during nap time. Nobody is perfect and we have 0-star days, but that’s not the chart’s fault!!
customer_reviews.author: guessnumber11

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Yes! My 5 year old loves this! She looks forwarded to adding “her stars” every night. It’s simple with pictures, so she can understand what each task means. I honestly bought this for my stubborn 3 year old, but the concept of a chart is lost on her. I’m hoping she’ll get the hang of it when she gets a little older. For now, I use it with my older child to help remind her about cleaning up and sharing. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars because it sticks to my fridge and also,,, my 4 year old daughter loves it! I love it too because now when she whines I tell her she wont get her star for the day and she stops! Miracle-worker! Every evening we go through each task and she gets to put the star next to the task she completed for the day. My FAVORITE is the one that says "doesn't interrupt while on the phone" (or something to that effect" and OH MY GOD I FINALLY had a phone call with ZERO interruptions thanks to this chart! LOVE! Not sure if the quality is worth the $20 but I cant argue the effectiveness!!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda St Pierre

customer_reviews.title: Common sense and options.  Outstanding product for success.
customer_reviews.text: This star chart is so easy to use and has a variety of tasks. With the options I’m able to adjust what’s on the chart towards positive reinforcement rather than setting my granddaughter up for failure with tasks she’s just not ready to perform just yet. It allows us to work towards those more difficult tasks together with maybe two stars for something big. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: PAYDAY

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter LOVES this thing. She is getting ready to turn 5. Previously she refused to dress herself or attempt to make her bed, brushing her teeth was always a struggle and she was always "too tired" to pick up her toys. 1 day with this chart and she is doing all the tasks independently (and well!). She does not even care about a weekly reward she just wants the stars. We have been using it a few weeks now and still going strong! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Linsy Glassman

customer_reviews.title: Great For 6 Year Old!
customer_reviews.text: What an effective tool to help my child set their own goals and reach the reward by taking care of themselves! My child asks throughout the day if they can get a star for various other tasks they complete. It's been so fun to see the self motivation and personal aptitude excel on my child's own. I love the customization capabilities on the tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica More

customer_reviews.title: Very clever and effective
customer_reviews.text: Very effective. My son has responded well to this reward chart. The only thing is that I can't fit as many tasks on it as I'd like so we had to pick and choose between things we were working on. I eventually upgraded to a larger posterboard that I made myself. That way we can fit more things on it and he has more opportunity to earn stars. I just had to buy more sticky velcro dots.
customer_reviews.author: melissa butler

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I used these with my kids, lost the sets in a move, and rebought. That's how well they work. The only real trick is consistency... We spend maybe 5 minutes going over their chart each evening, discussing how they did that day. They love their charts, and are motivated to get chores done and behave well, with much less nagging. Win/win.
customer_reviews.author: FrankandSense1975

customer_reviews.title: SO WORTH IT
customer_reviews.text: Combined this with a sticker chart - every day the 4 yr old hits a certain number of stars, he gets a sticker. Stickers add up for a toy. He loves it. We were struggling with yelling and whining and after 2 weeks with this, one day he told me "Mom, I don't want to whine anymore. I'm tired of whining." He's absolutely motivated to earn stars and it has been so much more fruitful for good behavior than swift time-outs. We do stars in the morning and again in the evening - it lets you save the stars for after each routine, so there's an incentive to earn the stars each part of the day.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Fun visual way to get your kids to accomplish set tasks
customer_reviews.text: I use this to get my son to accomplish his tasks to work towards “purchasing” rewards using the stars he has earned. It’s a good visual and reminder to keep my son on track. I wish the magnet was stronger as every time I pull the stars off the Velcro, the whole calendar falls off the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Its got everything! Love it! Def recommend!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE all the different choices included and the fact that they threw in a couple blank ones to create your own with for the "tasks". Love that its dry erase,and that it literally comes with everything you need for it. Just put it together and hung it so we can start today! Also super impress with the speed of delivery!
customer_reviews.author: Rebeccah herdener

customer_reviews.title: Good way to deal with threenager
customer_reviews.text: We have a defiant “threenager” and felt like we were always yelling! During the first week, she didn’t seem to understand or care but we made a big deal about adding stars. After she got her first 10 stars, she got a treat! And when she acted up in karate class, she had a star taken away. Now after every session we ask the instructor if it’s a “get a star” or “take away a star” kind of day. It’s really reinforcing good behavior which she can visualize. We go over what the different pictures mean. I like how it can be personalized with the blank squares. We highly recommend this !
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Turned our son behavior around
customer_reviews.text: We have a 5yo that was having some issues in class and at home. This was our fix! It came with so many great tasks and goals. He now has his first job of feeding the dog. He has his daily task for stars and gets to choose his reasonable rewards. It has strong magnets to go onto the fridge, with sturdy Velcro for the task and stars. Since we have implemented this we have seen such an improvement in his behavior. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CATHY P

customer_reviews.title: love this chart
customer_reviews.text: this was an excellent purchase. we are making so many improvements in behavior because of this chart. my only complaint is that you can't use more incentives at the same time, i'd love it to be longer with double the incentive options
customer_reviews.author: hannah

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s very easy to use and it even comes with extra stickers that you can write on there so you don’t have to use the ones that they give you so if you have something that the kid struggles with let’s say picking it snows then you could write that on there and say oh I don’t pick my nose today can I put a star on for today which is really cool I really liked it the piece is really Velcro to the other book was very nice and it didn’t have a weird chemical smell it came really really fast and actually arrive like within two days and I didn’t even pay extra for that
customer_reviews.author: MaKayla

customer_reviews.title: Thin but good thing to invest in
customer_reviews.text: Thin but good thing to invest in. My 3 year old was getting out of hand so I figured a Star chat would be perfect. Took a week or two to kick in (for her) It’s good on the fridge up high. It’s thin material and the Velcro Works fine. It’s cool cause I can make up my own task. But the pictures are always nice!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lela Thongdy

customer_reviews.title: Great chart 10/10
customer_reviews.text: I love this chart it makes my son go above and beyond and want to gain more stars This chart is perfect if they are not doing well in school or not listening this chart makes them want to listen and behave to gain stars and the reward at the end of the week
customer_reviews.author: Ramiro J Avalos

customer_reviews.title: Flawed Design
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea, hate the design. 2 tiny magnet strips to hang the chart, but the stars are held on by strong Velcro. Falls every time we remove a star or label. Would love to try the improved version.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Williams

customer_reviews.title: where to store the stars?
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to speed up the nighttime routine with my 2.5 yr old. The first night this worked brilliantly and pretty good the next couple of nights. Not sure how long it will stay fresh. My product did come slightly bent but my biggest issue is I have not figured out a method to store the stars. She just wants to play with them. I may have to stash them in a secret place but consistency is key so need to make it convenient too.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This has really helped my daughter! She loves having goals to work towards and putting the stars on her board. The only think I would add is a few blank squares to write your own goals for the week.
customer_reviews.author: Ambular

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was anxious to get started with my 6 year old granddaughter. The package arrived within a few days of ordering and I am pleased being able to hang this on the refrigerator. I ordered extra blocks and have plenty to choose from and can tailor the chart to meet our needs. So far my granddaughter is receptive to the daily activities and is excited to place her stars on the board for completed activities. The chart is not too big and works well! I would recommend this one to anyone needing a behavioral chart. I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: HappyCamper

customer_reviews.title: the options they give are not the one i need
customer_reviews.text: whining, good manner in the table those are the only ones will help in my personal case. they should allow to have blank sticker to add the options i may need in future, quality is ok not great, but among other similar products this is the best i found.
customer_reviews.author: Mpu

customer_reviews.title: Durable and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: This star reward chart is perfect. My 4 year old LOVES earning stars and the fact that you can make your own chore with their extra stickers and pieces is great. I love that they are Velcro and easy to reuse after each week. Magnets are sturdy and stays on the fridge no problem. Glad I ordered it!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Works well with 4 yr old but the quality is cheap and not worth the price at all. Should be like $8
customer_reviews.text: Works well with 4 yr old daughter. She is listening better. I tell her I'll take stars off if she's bad and will not earn her pick of present at the store. I tell her she needs 10 overall to get a prize. The quality material is cheap and definitely not worth the price. Your better off making your own and sticking magnets on the back. The stars are plastic and velcro backs
customer_reviews.author: ReviewFanatic4

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, assembly required...but I am still a fan
customer_reviews.text: This chart is so simple but effective. My two year old does very well with this chart and really likes it. For this reason I feel a little better about paying twenty bucks for a laminated chart with stickers and plastic stars. A few of the plastic squares come with stickers already on them but you have to apply the stickers to the rest. The same thing with the stars, some come with Velcro applied to the back but you have to apply the rest. Everything is provided (except for a dry erase marker) so it's no biggie but I just thought for a twenty dollar, it's components would be fully assembled and ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Bel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: The pictures on this is great and makes sense to my 3YO. I'm so happy that the stars are made of plastic and not just laminated paper. The tasks squares are also made of plastic and you put the stickers on them. THey come with circle velcros for the starts and task square and the actual poster comes with strips of magnet at the top and bottom so that it's ready to go on your fridge. My son loves this and we will rotate tasks every week. Highly recommend to encourage kids to be responsible.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce E

customer_reviews.title: Didnt like the velcro part
customer_reviews.text: Took stars away only because i didnt realize it was going to be velcro i thought it was all magnet and with only a coulple days of using it the velcro got ugly. Probably will last a full month
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Avelar

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Finally, making progress with my 3yr old now that we put the chart up together. It’s perfect, I was desperate after trying so many other strategies to help behavior issues... I had to get one for my 19 month old (she doesn’t need it, but earning a star has become competitive!) great product
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great reward chart. It had alot of good choices for goals. My son looks forward to putting the stars on at night. There are even blank ones to make your own tasks/ goals. I wish the calender was set up with Sunday 1st so he won't get confused when we transition to looking at a normal calender. I've recommended this to multiple friends!
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Kalawi

customer_reviews.title: toddlers like to do a star per action
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think of it ahead of time, but, toddlers like to do a star per action, not wait for one star at the end of the day. Nice chart but probably for older kids.
customer_reviews.author: mariabelle01

customer_reviews.title: Great rewards chart
customer_reviews.text: This chart is fantastic. I bought two for my three-year-old and six-year-old and I can use different goals for each child which is great. We use it weekly and they love it and it really works.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: It is a good motivator!
customer_reviews.text: Have been having some issues with our 3 year old since having a new baby! She is really into this board & it seems to be working. we give her a small toy/prize when she gets 15 stars (up from 10). It is a good motivator!
customer_reviews.author: EMMS

customer_reviews.title: Early to use, easy to understand
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this for only a few days, so we don’t know it’s long-term effect. But our initial experience has been overwhelmingly positive, with reminders about stars encouraging (or discouraging) specific types of behavior from our four-and-half year-old.
customer_reviews.author: Ross W. Beales

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: This is is a great chart for a young child. We use it with our two year old. I was surprised that “follow directions” was not a standard but I appreciate the number of blank squares to make our own. I also like that it has both negative “don’t do...” and positive “use good manners.”
customer_reviews.author: grinchbird

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to assemble and has given us a great way ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my son who is 5 and my 3.5 year old daughter was so eager for chore assignments that we got her her very own chore chart. It was easy to assemble and has given us a great way to encourage and reward good choices and habits. The pictures help the kids hold themselves and each other accountable and it even has a place to list your goal and reward. There is a minimal amount of assembly required - 3-5 minutes before you can start using it.
customer_reviews.author: CleanEatingMessyLife

customer_reviews.title: Do not reccomend
customer_reviews.text: First of all, it arrived bent, so the bottom magnets won't even attach. The magnets aren't even that strong, so I will have to figure something else out. It doesn't come completely assembled. It came with a few extra stickers to add your own, but there were no extra plastic pieces to attach them to. Overall, it was way too expensive for the quality. Hoping that it will at least help my child before it falls apart.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Winkler

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, very good execution
customer_reviews.text: The chart is colorful and attention grabbing (a must), and there is a wide variety of tasks/chores included. In just one week my 2-year-old understands what her "task" is and that she gets a star when she completes it, so it's working! We think it's important to talk to her about the chart every day, and that she chooses the reward - that approach has gotten her very excited.. My only complaint is that the chart comes with magnets on the back to hang on the refrigerator, but they aren't very strong so it basically falls down when you touch it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It really helped with our boys and remembering to do their chores, manners, and good habits because they like putting the stars on their. We put a weekly reward (something small) and a monthly star reward (obviously bigger). This has helped them and me not always having to repeat myself/ remind them to do something.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Best combo
customer_reviews.text: It’s exactly what I was looking for (graphic + written description for each task), but the dry erase part at the bottom where you write in the # of stars and reward does not erase even when using a normal dry erase marker. Would also prefer that the days of the week began with Sunday (not Monday).
customer_reviews.author: Klever K

customer_reviews.title: So Great!
customer_reviews.text: My four year old was beginning to have major attitude problems and a sense of entitlement. I was at my wit's end until I started researching behavior charts. I originally wanted the Melissa & Doug one because it is prettier, but this chart had squares that addressed our every issue (no whining, clean up toys, make your bed, brush your teeth, etc.). No joke, since we bought this chart and implemented a reward system, my four year old has been on her best behavior most of the time! I have recommended this to everyone I know who can use a little help in the parenting arena.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool!
customer_reviews.text: We got this to help our almost three year old with potty training. He's a little young for the delayed gratification of getting one star per day, so I just take all of the stars off each day and he gets a treat if he gets however many stars or if he goes all day with no accident. He really likes putting the stars on himself each time, and it's helped to motivate him to potty, clean up his messes etc. The great thing is that there are so many activities that he can use this for a long time. I have recommended to a lot of friends already!
customer_reviews.author: njbruhn

customer_reviews.title: Great for teaching toddler's lessons
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool to practice lessons with a toddler. I started out using all fields for my 3-year-old but it was a bit tricky to manage. I have now started to work on things she struggles with i.e. being kind to her baby sister; taking care of pets, and cleaning up her mess. This has really helped her to focus on 3 things for the week and even without the stars, she is doing so well in those areas now. And she loves to put the stars up on her chart! The chart is also great quality so I'm confident it will last us years!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Caplin

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: The chart is flimsy! It should be made with stronger material. There are limited supplies, but to honest I stopped using it because it just doesn't look nice on the refrigerator. Looks cheap.
customer_reviews.author: L.W.

customer_reviews.title: great, helps with positive reinforcement
customer_reviews.text: We use this for rewarding our 5 year old daughter. We have had it for over a year and it still helps with discipline. She loves feeling like she is wining stars by cleaning or helping around the house. We love it but we are not 100% consistent with it. I think if we were our daughter would benefit even more from it. As for the actual quality of the item. Everything has held up nicely. The stars stay in place, the board hasn't ripped, etc. Its a good quality item.
customer_reviews.author: hiowatha

customer_reviews.title: Cute chore chart for younger kids
customer_reviews.text: I like this system. Its easy to understand BUT its not perfect. I wish the included chores had a little more substance to them so that it wasn't necessary to buy the supplements. Having 2 kids of different ages (so having 2 charts) I needed two different kinds of chores. I also don't like that I have to put the Velcro on each stinkin star as we use it. Lazy, yes...but over the first week has been a bit annoying and dragged the process out longer than necessary.Over-all it will do what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Junell

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Wish I would have bought it sooner! My toddler is so excited to get a star that she goes to bed and stays in bed all night!!!! She also loves helping with taking care of the dog and it’s even helped her to eat all of her dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Love the reward chart!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the purchase! We had some hard time to get our 3 year-old to listen to us especially when asking him to take his bath, clean up his toys, go to bed, etc... with this ‘I can do it’ reward chart, he’s now motivated to do it so he can get all the stars he needs to trade for a treat/toy he wants from us. It’s a win-win strategy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars For You!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, parents, just yes. Our son loves “getting stars” and a “small present” for filling up a row or a “big present” for filling up the entire chart!
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Task board with pictures
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old doesn’t read yet, so I really like how this task board has pictures. Good quality magnet on board and good velcro for the stars and tasks. Overall very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what we did before I got this chart. My daughter was always getting up in the middle of the night, and we couldn't figure out how to fix it. I bought this, and we started giving her stars for staying in bed and sleeping all night. Within about a week she stopped coming into our room, and she now sleeps all night without issues. We are also using the chart to help to learn other good behaviors, and it is working like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Such a awesome idea and great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for toddlers to visually see what they need to do. My toddler had transformed so much using this chart! I love it and so does she,she is so excited to put stars on it!
customer_reviews.author: Pandabliss

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My son who just turns 4 enjoys this chart. We've had it less than a week but he looks forward to putting his own stars on each night. Our fridge isn't magnetic so I poked two holes at the top of the chart and used twine to hang it up in his room. It's a cute chart with easy to understand pictures (he can't read yet). Great product!
customer_reviews.author: charli21

customer_reviews.title: Helps my son!
customer_reviews.text: You have to put together the stars and velco, but very easy to do. The chart is nice- you will need a dry erase marker if you want to write on the board, not included.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Simple & Clear
customer_reviews.text: Very easy for a toddler to understand. Only issue with this was that the magnets do not work and it does not come with a dry erase maker, so make sure you buy one if you purchase this item. Kenyon Kids should think about providing one with the package and feel free to charge an extra 50 cents to one dollar. It would have been great to have everything needed in one package to allow for immediate use but now I have to hold off until going to the store. I also used 3m tape to hang on wall do to the magnets not working.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Missing items
customer_reviews.text: Hey ! So I like this product , it gets my son really excited to do his chores. The only complaint I have is with the product description. It says it comes with 5 chores but I only received 5 & when i reached out to the seller about this I did not get a response in return. I would only suggest they change the description if it doesn’t give you the full package.
customer_reviews.author: Nishawn

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product to keep kids on track
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product to keep kids on track. Really nice with the pictures for children that are not able to read. Only wish is that you could make print outs for the blank squares. Update: after about 2 months, we have stopped using this product. Having a reward every week seemed to be a bit much. I plan to keep this product and return to it when she is older to help remember chores. The reason I am keeping it 5 stars is that it can be used for smaller children (around age 3) and older ones (I am hoping around age 5-10ish).
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Reward System!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a WONDERFUL reward system!!!! We are using it for our 4 year old son and it's been a great motivator for him. I especially like "Getting Dressed" and "Going to Bed and Staying in Bed" options. It's also nice to have some write on options. We added "Getting Ready for School" as a choice. The stars stick on nicely with Velcro. Easy to change goal and reward with a Expo marker. I would highly recommend this reward system!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful way to reinforce positive behavior
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2.5 year old daughter when she started acting out due to her baby sister being born. It's a great way to reinforce good behavior. My daughter LOVES getting a gold star and her favorite part of our evening routine is sitting down and determining how many gold stars she earned that day. The best part about this system is you can tailor it to your individual child's needs. I switch some of the goals out on a weekly basis as we tackle new issues/problems and as she gets older and no longer needs certain goals like using the potty.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Tien

customer_reviews.title: Very colorful
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old is excited about putting stars on it when she completes something. We’ve been having a lot of crying and whining due to a new sibling so I believe this will encourage her to have better days.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: We love this chart!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chart for my 6 year old who needs a little help learning to take some responsibility. It has helped having a visual of the things that need to be completed before getting a reward! This chart is great because it sticks to the refrigerator, it comes with extra stars, it's all Velcro, no tape, no glue, NO MESS!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Have a 4 year old in that stage where they dont want to listen, and going to try this. Nice board, doesnt come with a dry erase marker. which you may or may not need. Comes with a few blank stickers to come up with your own tasks.
customer_reviews.author: nards444

customer_reviews.title: Great concept but...
customer_reviews.text: My child loves this, but the velcro on many spots came damaged and a few were missing altogether.
customer_reviews.author: IrieLove

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 2 year old, I thought the chart was a little complicated for a two year old to follow, I really just wanted the components to make my own simpler chart. When he is a bit older I will implement the chart kenson chart. Overall very pleased with the product, it can grow with your child.
customer_reviews.author: Seree Collie

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This works well for a smart 4 year old who loves to earn stars. She got it right off the bat, is ok with rotation of chores, looks forward to the daily tally. Her two year old sister will have to learn what it means to earn a star, right now she is simply tacking up columns of stars and taking them down again. The chart sticks to the dishwasher well, the stars and chores stick to the chart well. The chores are all appropriate for kids and there are blanks for adding your own. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ursula K

customer_reviews.title: Great at helping you teach your child about goals
customer_reviews.text: I had bought one for my first child and it's been working well so we bought one for our second child who is now old enough to use it. Great at helping you teach your child about goals and tracking them. Only advice, just make sure to set time aside to handing out stars every night.
customer_reviews.author: SamIamWhitey

customer_reviews.title: Great concept & accountability tool
customer_reviews.text: This could be good. My daughter seemed very interested in this tonight. She is three. Hopefully this sticks. I don’t like how it doesn’t have plastic plates/ backings for the blanks. Could have also added more space for more responsibilities.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mekdeci

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my 3 and 4 year old! The pictures make it easy for them to understand their responsibilities and they love getting to put on the stars every day. We've started with just 2-3 chores and the plan is to add more as they adjust to the expectation. I love that there are so many age-appropriate options to choose from. We're two weeks in and all is great--I'll update if anything changes!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It's good but can improve. We use it with our kids
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent task list for young children
customer_reviews.text: Great to do list for kids. My 3 year old loves to see the stars go up next to her chores. After she has completed one of the tasks she loves to put a star up next to her task. I've tried homemade lists & a few other chore lists from different stores. This one has very easy to understand pictures of the chores. My 3 year old is knows exactly what each one means by looking at the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Ponce

customer_reviews.title: so far it’s been working great! my kids understand how it works they put ...
customer_reviews.text: so far it’s been working great! my kids understand how it works they put their own stars and when they don’t listen i take a star away. my only problem would be that the back has the option of magnet to stick to the fridge i wish it had other options to hang it else where for instance their bedroom but thats not a deal breaker
customer_reviews.author: conniiegee

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great chore chart although I didn’t realize how it was geared to the very young, under 5 most likely. It did come with blanks so we made our own up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Chore/Responsibility Chart!!
customer_reviews.text: This chart has been great to keep our munchkin on track and learning new responsibilities. The Velcro "chores" and stars are easy to put on and remove. I love all the options of "chores" it comes with. My daughter is 2 1/2 and there are ones as she grows up that we can change out to. Plus when we get towards the end of the week she can see the areas she needs to "work on" and it helps her going forward!!
customer_reviews.author: Kira Sedivy

customer_reviews.title: Great product to create a calm home.
customer_reviews.text: This product is very well made and helps our child understand the nighttime routine. We have tried other products, but this works best by far. Our child loves the pictures of the specific tasks and that one can receive stars towards are a reward that you can write on the whiteboard. Also, all the stars and pictures are attached by velcro, which is helpful. I definitely recommend this product to all parents that have young kids. It makes routines fun, clear, and rewarding. Great Product!
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this. This board is absolutely perfect. I am a behavior therapist and I wanted something similar to what we use at work to use at home. I didn't want to spend the money on supplies to make one so I got this. It's perfect. We use this every single day and it has motivated my 6 year old. He loves putting his stars on every night.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya S.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This works as a reward system and help my daughter with potty training.
customer_reviews.author: Papo

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: The use ability is great, I just wish they had more chores. Or at least the ability to write your own- like if they sent extra blank ones.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Love this!! My 5 year old loves it to, great reward chart and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my Kindergartner
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have been trying hard to correct some behaviors lately in a positive way and were thrilled to find this! I think the important thing to remember is that the chart doesn't 'fix' behaviors and it is just a tool. For us, it has worked and has helped improve the behaviors that we were wanting to correct. It has great pre-printed incentives, but it is easy to change them out and make new ones. My daughter loves the stars and putting them on.
customer_reviews.author: Atredes

customer_reviews.title: Great Star Chart
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old is responding very well to her star chart. We have included the stars in our bedtime routine and we talk about her day. This chart is nice because you can only use what you want the focus to be on or up to 6 categories. It's made from a high quality laminated card stock and the Velcro dots hold everything up nicely. I recommend this chart for younger kids, maybe 3-8.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this reward chart. Easy to read and set up and lots of options.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome reward chart. My 3year old son took to it right away and enjoys earning stars.
customer_reviews.author: Donelle Heieie

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful Product
customer_reviews.text: We have ordered this multiple times and found that It works for all of our grandchildren.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, my favorite so far and this is our 3rd rewards chart. The others she didn't seem into but this one she loves putting on the stars. Our daughter is 4
customer_reviews.author: caliBOOKS

customer_reviews.title: Way overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty disappointed by this chart. The magnetic strips on the back aren't strong enough to hold it to my fridge with the curve of the laminated paper - and it's just laminated paper. The Velcro dots aren't on the backs of the stars and squares so you have to do it yourself...I just feel like I could have made this myself with my laminator if I'd known it was like this.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Great incentive for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son, and we have had lots of fun deciding what to work on each week. He is very proud of his stars and it fosters good discussions about what behavior we like to see and what isn't so productive for young folks. (: My sister has one too, and it's interesting to see the two cousins discuss each other's charts when they visit their houses. It lends more credibility to the whole exercise when they see other kids/households doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Irene T

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Stars stay on securley. This has been an amazing tool for our foster children. I love that there are blank tiles as well as numerous pre selected tiles. If I could change one thing, it would be to add more grids. Not a biggie though. You can always buy two.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Worked amazing for our daughter
customer_reviews.text: This has worked extremely well for our daughter. Her attitude and willingness to complete chores and task has greatly improved.
customer_reviews.author: iLL Gil 710

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea
customer_reviews.text: My Son is super excited and actually trying to complete each task everyday
customer_reviews.author: Alma

customer_reviews.title: It helps
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t think my son would actually go along with the chart but he actually likes it and it love to do things jus to get a star. It does help a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Whittney

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Great chart. We love that we can switch out the tiles and work on different manners, behaviors, and tasks depending on the week. My son likes putting the starts on the chart too, they are Velcro and easy to add and remove. He is 3 years old so he isn't quite understanding the rewards he will get but that will come with time.
customer_reviews.author: Sheena

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for your little one
customer_reviews.text: Got this to help my 3 year old with potty training and cleaning up. I love the ability to change the tasks and create custom ones. He loves putting the stars on each day. Also, the velcro is perfect and has held up really well.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly helpful!
customer_reviews.text: Love this chore chart. Teaching responsibility is tough. This chart helps my son see his progress and helps us remember to praise him for all his stars!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia r. Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality only reason I gave it 4 out of ...
customer_reviews.text: Great quality only reason I gave it 4 out of 5 stars is you have to put almost all the stickers on the little squares and sticky stuff on the stars. It's great quality and I'm sure will work for my son in a few months aka he's not exactly ready for it... oh and it's meant for the fridge or a magnetic surface. But still great quality and I'm sure will be great in the years to come
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Stone

customer_reviews.title: Fun, great motivator.
customer_reviews.text: This is working out great. I wish it had more rows for tasks but minimizing the rows also keeps it from becoming overwhelming and helps my family keep focused on the important things. We used a whiteboard marker to add extra notes to some items (such as watering the plants, something that only has to be done 1x/wk).
customer_reviews.author: September

product_meta.title: Kenson Kids "I Can Do It" Reward and Responsibility Chart, 11 X 15.5-Inch
feature_bullets: INCREASED INCENTIVES: Having trouble getting your kids to pick up after themselves. Are you endlessly prompting them to do their homework. Wouldn't you love to hear please and thank you more often. The "I Can Do It." Reward Chart can help. Children thrive on praise and a little incentive goes a long way. This chart gives parents the tools to help raise more responsible, self- reliant kids.

EVERYTHING YOU NEED: There are 20 different, colorful chores and behaviors to choose from in your chart. It comes with 45 reusable plastic stars that kids love to earn. The sturdy plastic stars and chores attach easily with hook and loop fasteners, so they stay in place.

PERFECT ANYWHERE IN YOUR HOME: It has strong magnetic strips to hold it securely to any metal surface, like your refrigerator. It includes two hang tabs as well, so it can be hung almost anywhere. The sturdy plastic stars and chores attach easily with hook and loop fasteners, so they stay in place, making it a reliable and secure teaching method.

BUILD SELF ESTEEM: Kids develop a positive self-esteem and sense of independence when they feel they are contributing to the family and can make their own choices. Motivating instead of trying to control your child's behaviors will help mold him or her to be the best they can be. The "I Can Do It." reward chart brings some of these valuable lessons to life.

PRODUCT SPECIFICATIONS: Package contains (1) Kenson Kids "I Can Do It" Reward Chart. Includes: Get dressed, go potty, brush your teeth, no whining, get along, good manners, make bed, set table, help with dishes, go to bed, please and thank you, no mean words, no yelling, eat your veggies, no harming others, feed pets, share toys, water plants, clean mess, and 3 blank labels. 11" x 15.5"

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,329 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
